text:
Andrew Scott as Hamlet at the Almeida – in pictures   View more sharing options Share   Close 
Scott, best known as Sherlock’s Moriarty, is playing the highest-profile Hamlet since Benedict Cumberbatch took on the role in 2015. Here is an exclusive first look at the production
Tuesday 28 February 2017 00.01 GMT 

Graveyard duty … Andrew Scott in Hamlet at the Almeida, directed by Robert Icke. All photographs: Manuel Harlan Facebook Twitter Pinterest 

Angus Wright as Claudius, Scott as Hamlet and Juliet Stevenson as Gertrude. Icke previously directed Wright in Oresteia and Stevenson in Mary Stuart Facebook Twitter Pinterest 

Jessica Brown Findlay, another Oresteia star, plays Ophelia and Luke Thompson plays Laertes. The production features Ophelia’s Song written by Laura Marling Facebook Twitter Pinterest 

Scott with Amaka Okafor as Guildenstern and Calum Finlay as Rosencrantz. The production is designed by Hildegard Bechtler Facebook Twitter Pinterest 

David Rintoul as the Player King and Marty Cruickshank as the Player Queen Facebook Twitter Pinterest 

Hamlet is at the Almeida until 15 April Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Theatre Andrew Scott Robert Icke William Shakespeare Almeida theatre
